cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ESE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north then accelerate northeast, hugging the U.S. East Coast, moving inland over eastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina Monday night and then racing north-northeast along the Mid-Atlantic seaboard toward southern New England.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ocracoke Inlet NC northward to Watch Hill RI, including Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds, Chesapeake Bay, Tidal Potomac River and Delaware Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL to Ocracoke Inlet NC (Tropical Storm Warning); Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC (Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida to New England, including Delaware Bay and the New Jersey–Delaware–Pennsylvania shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–50 mph, gusts 50–60 mph) are possible Tuesday afternoon into Tuesday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible in Delaware Bay and tidal Delaware River; lower values expected upriver at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain with locally higher totals could produce flash and urban flooding in the Philadelphia area Tuesday–Tuesday night.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous rip currents and elevated river levels that could hinder vessel traffic and cargo handling.
